1.description: A boy living with the fisherman Arsheesh in Calormen. He has fair skin and feels like an outsider. When a Tarkaan arrives, Shasta overhears that he is not Arsheesh's son and is about to be sold as a slave. Discovers he can understand the talking horse Bree and learns he was found as a baby. Agrees to escape to Narnia with Bree to avoid being sold into slavery.

14.description: Revealed to be Prince Cor of Archenland, twin brother to Prince Corin. He was kidnapped as a baby by Lord Bar but was lost when Bar died. Found by Arsheesh who raised him.

2.description: A young Tarkheena (noble lady) of Calormen fleeing an unwanted marriage to the elderly Ahoshta. She is proud, brave, and skilled in riding and archery. Travels with her talking mare Hwin.

15.description: Chooses to remain in Archenland and eventually marries Shasta/Prince Cor. Becomes a beloved queen of Archenland.

1.description: A talking horse from Narnia who has been enslaved in Calormen for years. He is proud, somewhat vain, and knowledgeable about both countries. Convinces Shasta to escape with him to return to Narnia.

15.description: Returns to his beloved Narnia and lives happily in the Western Woods, occasionally visiting Archenland to see his friends.

2.description: A talking mare from Narnia who has been Aravis's horse in Calormen. She is gentle, wise, and more humble than Bree. Yearns to return to her homeland in Narnia.

8.description: A great lion who appears to chase the companions, spurring them to greater speed in their flight north. His presence terrifies but also somehow protects them.

10.description: Revealed to be Aslan, the great Lion of Narnia and son of the Emperor-Beyond-the-Sea. He has been guiding and protecting Shasta throughout his journey, appearing at crucial moments.

4.description: Now an adult King of Narnia, ruling alongside his siblings. He is part of a diplomatic mission to Tashbaan and is wise and experienced in statecraft.
Now an adult Queen of Narnia, known for her beauty and gentleness. She is the target of Prince Rabadash's marriage proposal, which she politely but firmly declines.

13.description: The High King of Narnia who arrives with reinforcements during the battle at Anvard. He commands with authority and helps secure victory over the Calormene forces.
The youngest Queen of Narnia who arrives with the reinforcements. She carries her magic cordial and helps tend to the wounded after the battle.

11.description: The King of Archenland, a sturdy and just ruler who leads a hunting party when he meets Shasta. He takes Shasta's warning seriously and prepares his kingdom for war.

14.description: Revealed to be Shasta's father. He explains how his infant son Cor was kidnapped by the treacherous Lord Bar, and how he searched for him for years.

4.description: The young Prince of Archenland visiting Tashbaan. He is brave, impulsive, and loves fighting and adventure. Shasta is mistaken for him due to their identical appearance.

14.description: Revealed to be Shasta's twin brother. Though younger by a few minutes, he will remain the heir as Shasta prefers a quieter life.

hermit-southern-march.name: The Hermit of the Southern March

12.description: A wise old hermit who lives at the border between Archenland and Calormen. He provides shelter to Aravis, Bree, and Hwin, and has mystical abilities to see distant events.

14.description: A treacherous lord of Archenland who kidnapped the infant Prince Cor (Shasta) but died while fleeing south. His death led to Shasta being found by Arsheesh.

5.description: The Emperor of Calormen, an aging despot who rules with absolute power. He meets with Prince Rabadash and the Grand Vizier to plan the invasion of Archenland and Narnia.
The proud and arrogant Prince of Calormen who desires to marry Queen Susan. When rejected, he plans to invade Narnia and Archenland to take her by force.

13.description: Leads the Calormene invasion force against Anvard but is defeated and captured. He becomes stuck in a window while trying to escape, leading to his humiliation.

2.description: An elderly and wealthy Calormene lord whom Aravis is being forced to marry. She finds him repulsive and cruel.

5.description: Revealed to be the Grand Vizier of Calormen, the Tisroc's chief advisor. He counsels the Tisroc on the invasion plans and political strategy.

1.description: A poor fisherman in Calormen who found Shasta as a baby and raised him. He is greedy and unkind, treating Shasta more like a servant than a son, and is eager to sell him to the visiting Tarkaan.
A Calormene lord who arrives at Arsheesh's hut wanting to buy Shasta as a slave. His horse is actually the talking horse Bree, who convinces Shasta to escape with him.

5.description: Aravis's childhood friend, now a wealthy and fashionable Tarkheena in Tashbaan. She is vain and frivolous but ultimately loyal, helping Aravis despite not understanding her desire to escape.

4.description: The faun who serves as part of the Narnian delegation in Tashbaan. He recognizes that Shasta is not Prince Corin but keeps quiet about it.
A Narnian lord who is part of King Edmund and Queen Susan's diplomatic mission to Tashbaan. He is among those who mistake Shasta for Prince Corin.
Another Narnian lord accompanying the royal delegation to Tashbaan. He is courteous and diplomatic in his duties.

9.description: Various talking animals that Shasta encounters in the mountains of Archenland. At first he mistakes them for ordinary beasts or jackals, but they prove to be friendly and helpful.

13.description: The military force of Narnia that arrives as reinforcements during the battle at Anvard, led by High King Peter and Queen Lucy.

11.description: The knights and soldiers of Archenland who serve King Lune. They prepare for the defense of their realm when warned of the Calormene invasion.

7.description: The army pursuing the four companions north, part of Prince Rabadash's invasion force heading to attack Archenland.

3.description: Wealthy Calormene nobles seen in the streets of Tashbaan, displaying their wealth and status as the companions pass through the city.
The guards who patrol Tashbaan and maintain order in the great city. They are present when the companions enter and leave the city.

5.description: The many slaves who serve in Lasaraleen's luxurious household, attending to her every need in typical Calormene fashion.
The various nobles and officials who populate the Tisroc's court, witnesses to the secret meeting about the invasion plans.

7.description: Various people traveling through the desert that the companions encounter during their flight north.

12.description: The various animals that live with the Hermit of the Southern March in his peaceful dwelling.
The soldiers and guards defending King Lune's castle of Anvard against Prince Rabadash's attack.

13.description: Soldiers from both sides who are wounded during the battle at Anvard and receive care after the fighting ends.

2.description: Aravis's cruel stepmother who arranged her marriage to Ahoshta. She is mentioned as part of the reason Aravis chose to flee rather than submit to the unwanted marriage.
A Calormene Tarkaan who agreed to his daughter's marriage to the Grand Vizier, presumably for political and financial gain.
The Calormene nobles who owned Hwin before she came to serve Aravis, mentioned as part of her history in captivity.

1.description: Other horses that Bree fought alongside during his years in the Calormene army, mentioned as part of his military experience.
The people of the small fishing village where Arsheesh lives with Shasta, mentioned as the community they are part of.

11.description: The nobles and huntsmen accompanying King Lune when they encounter Shasta in the mountains of Archenland.
The various servants and staff who work in King Lune's castle at Anvard, preparing for war and caring for guests.
Young nobles and companions of Prince Corin who are eager for adventure and fighting, much like the prince himself.

4.description: The crew of the Narnian ship that brought the diplomatic mission to Tashbaan.

3.description: Religious officials in Tashbaan who serve the Calormene god Tash, seen performing their duties in the great city.
The various merchants and traders selling goods in the markets of Tashbaan as the companions pass through the city.
Poor children seen in the streets of Tashbaan, representing the common people of the great Calormene capital.

5.description: Court officials who serve in the Tisroc's palace, present during the secret meeting about the invasion plans.
The servant who guards the doors to the Tisroc's private chambers and announces visitors during the secret meeting.

1.description: Servants responsible for caring for horses in various locations, including those at Arsheesh's village and in Tashbaan.

4.description: The captain of the Narnian vessel that brought the diplomatic mission to Tashbaan, responsible for the ship and crew.

3.description: The proprietors of inns and taverns in Tashbaan where travelers can find food and lodging.
Merchants selling water to travelers in Tashbaan and along the desert routes, essential for survival in the hot climate.
Professional guides who lead camel caravans through the desert routes, experienced in desert travel.
Mystics and charlatans in Tashbaan who claim to predict the future for paying customers.
Performers in the streets and palaces of Tashbaan who provide entertainment with various instruments.

5.description: Court officials who record the Tisroc's decrees and handle official correspondence.
Entertainers at the Calormene court who provide amusement for the Tisroc and his nobles.
Merchants who sell exotic scents and oils, particularly catering to wealthy Calormene ladies like Lasaraleen.

3.description: Wealthy traders dealing in fine fabrics and luxurious clothing in the markets of Tashbaan.
Merchants selling exotic spices and seasonings in the bustling markets of the Calormene capital.

11.description: Craftsmen in Archenland who forge weapons and repair equipment for King Lune's forces preparing for war.
Senior servants responsible for the care of horses and other animals at Anvard castle.
Talking birds that serve as messengers between different locations, helping coordinate the defense against the Calormene invasion.

13.description: Medical practitioners who tend to the wounded after the battle at Anvard, working alongside Queen Lucy's magic cordial.

11.description: The kitchen staff at Anvard who prepare meals for the court, guests, and army during the preparations for war.

15.description: Musicians and storytellers who will record and sing about the adventures of Shasta and his companions for future generations.

recaps.1: Shasta, a boy living with fisherman Arsheesh in Calormen, overhears that he's not Arsheesh's real son and is about to be sold to a visiting Tarkaan. He discovers the Tarkaan's horse Bree can talk and learns he's from Narnia. Together they decide to escape northward to the free lands of Narnia.
recaps.2: Shasta and Bree meet Aravis, a young Tarkheena fleeing an unwanted marriage, and her talking horse Hwin. The four agree to travel together to Narnia. They learn they must pass through the great city of Tashbaan, capital of the Calormene Empire.
recaps.3: The travelers approach Tashbaan at dawn and plan to pass through quickly. However, Shasta is mistaken for Prince Corin of Archenland by Narnian lords and taken to their lodgings. Aravis goes separately into the city with a plan to meet later.
recaps.4: Shasta finds himself among the Narnian delegation, including King Edmund and Queen Susan, who mistake him for Prince Corin. He learns they are in Tashbaan on a diplomatic mission and that Prince Rabadash of Calormen wishes to marry Queen Susan.
recaps.5: Aravis seeks out her friend Lasaraleen Tarkheena in Tashbaan's upper city. Meanwhile, the real Prince Corin appears and Shasta escapes. Aravis overhears a secret meeting where the Tisroc, Prince Rabadash, and the Grand Vizier plot to invade Archenland and Narnia.
recaps.6: Aravis learns the Calormenes plan to attack when the Narnians refuse Rabadash's marriage proposal. She escapes with Lasaraleen's help to warn the others. The four companions reunite and plan to race north to warn Archenland of the coming invasion.
recaps.7: The companions begin their desperate ride north through the desert to outrun the Calormene army and warn King Lune of Archenland. They push their horses hard but realize they're being pursued by a large force led by Prince Rabadash.
recaps.8: Continuing their flight, the group encounters a lion (Aslan in disguise) who chases them, spurring them to greater speed. Shasta becomes separated from the others when his horse bolts in terror from the lion.
recaps.9: Shasta finds himself alone in the misty mountains of Archenland, lost and frightened. He encounters what he believes are jackals but are actually talking beasts who help him. A mysterious presence comforts him through the night.
recaps.10: Shasta discovers he has been talking to Aslan, who explains how he has been guiding and protecting Shasta throughout his journey. Aslan reveals some of Shasta's true history before disappearing at dawn.
recaps.11: Shasta reaches Archenland and is found by King Lune and his hunting party. He delivers his warning about the Calormene invasion, and preparations begin for the defense of the realm. Shasta meets Prince Corin, amazed by their resemblance.
recaps.12: The battle for Anvard begins as Prince Rabadash and his forces attack the castle. Shasta finds himself caught up in the fighting, while Aravis, Bree, and Hwin have taken refuge with the Hermit of the Southern March.
recaps.13: The battle continues with King Lune's forces defending Anvard. Edmund and the Narnian forces arrive as reinforcements. Prince Rabadash is defeated and captured when he becomes stuck in a window while trying to escape.
recaps.14: After the victory, King Lune reveals that Shasta is actually Prince Cor, his long-lost son and twin to Prince Corin. The story of Shasta's kidnapping as a baby and his rescue is told. Shasta learns his true identity and place in the royal family.
recaps.15: The story concludes with the aftermath of the battle and Shasta's acceptance of his royal identity. Aravis chooses to remain in Archenland, and both she and Shasta are granted their heart's desires. The tale ends with hints of their future together.
